clinical_study.official_title: Hypotension Prediction Index (HPI) Software Guided Hemodynamic Management for Noncardiac Surgery Patients - Blood Pressure Trial

brief_summary.textblock: A multicenter, randomized comparison of intraoperative hemodynamic management with or without a protocolized strategy utilizing Hypotension Prediction Index (HPI) software guidance during moderate-to-high-risk noncardiac surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: A composite of 30-day moderate-to-severe perfusion related postoperative complications.
primary_outcome.time_frame: From post non-cardiac surgery to 30 days.
primary_outcome.description: A composite of 30-day moderate-to-severe perfusion related postoperative complications.

arm_group.description: AcumenTM HPI Software Feature to guide hemodynamic management in moderate-to-high-risk noncardiac surgery.
Non-protocolized standard of care management per clinician and provider judgement

intervention.description: The AcumenTM HPI Feature Software provides the clinician with physiological insight into a patient's likelihood of trending toward a hypotensive event. The AcumenTM HPI Feature Software suite is enabled by the minimally invasive Acumen IQ sensor.
Non-protocolized standard of care to treat subjects
